media.caption: the flag of the UK is used

media.alt: Satellite photo of the island of Cyprus. The Dhekelia Sovereign Base Area is located north of the southeastern indent (Larnaca Bay). Image courtesy of NASA.
media.caption: Satellite photo of the island of Cyprus. The Dhekelia Sovereign Base Area is located north of the southeastern indent (Larnaca Bay). Image courtesy of NASA.

fields.name: Background
fields.content: By terms of the 1960 Treaty of Establishment that created the independent Republic of Cyprus, the UK retained full sovereignty and jurisdiction over two areas of almost 254 square kilometers - Akrotiri and Dhekelia. The larger of these is the Dhekelia Sovereign Base Area, which is also referred to as the Eastern Sovereign Base Area.

fields.name: Location
fields.content: Eastern Mediterranean, on the southeast coast of Cyprus near Famagusta

fields.name: Map references
fields.content: Middle East

fields.name: Area
fields.content: total: 131 sq km

fields.name: Area - comparative
fields.content: about three-quarters the size of Washington, DC

fields.name: Land boundaries
fields.content:
total: 108 km

border countries (1): Cyprus 108 km

fields.name: Climate
fields.content: temperate; Mediterranean with hot, dry summers and cool winters

fields.name: Environment - current issues
fields.content: netting and trapping of small migrant songbirds in the spring and autumn

fields.name: Geography - note
fields.content: British extraterritorial rights also extended to several small off-post sites scattered across Cyprus; several small Cypriot enclaves exist within the Sovereign Base Area (SBA); of the SBA land, 60% is privately owned and farmed, 20% is owned by the Ministry of Defense, and 20% is SBA Crown land

fields.name: Population
fields.content: approximately 15,500 on the Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia including 9,700 Cypriots and 5,800 Service and UK-based contract personnel and dependents
fields.subfield_note: approximately 15,500 on the Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia including 9,700 Cypriots and 5,800 Service and UK-based contract personnel and dependents

fields.name: Languages
fields.content: English, Greek

fields.name: HIV/AIDS - adult prevalence rate
fields.content: NA

fields.name: Country name
fields.content:
conventional long form: none

conventional short form: Dhekelia

fields.name: Dependency status
fields.content: a special form of UK overseas territory; administered by an administrator who is also the Commander, British Forces Cyprus

fields.name: Capital
fields.content:
name: Episkopi Cantonment (base administrative center for Akrotiri and Dhekelia); located in Akrotiri

geographic coordinates: 34 40 N, 32 51 E

time difference: UTC+2 (7 hours ahead of Washington, DC, during Standard Time)

daylight saving time: +1hr, begins last Sunday in March; ends last Sunday in October

fields.field_note: etymology: "Episkopi" means "episcopal" in Greek and stems from the fact that the site previously served as the bishop's seat of an Orthodox diocese

fields.name: Constitution
fields.content: history: presented 3 August 1960, effective 16 August 1960 (The Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia Order in Council 1960, serves as a basic legal document); amended 1966

subfields.name: history
subfields.content: presented 3 August 1960, effective 16 August 1960 (The Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia Order in Council 1960, serves as a basic legal document); amended 1966
subfields.value: presented 3 August 1960, effective 16 August 1960 (The Sovereign Base Areas of Akrotiri and Dhekelia Order in Council 1960, serves as a basic legal document); amended 1966
subfields.title: history

fields.name: Legal system
fields.content: laws applicable to the Cypriot population are, as far as possible, the same as the laws of the Republic of Cyprus; note - the Sovereign Base Area Administration has its own court system to deal with civil and criminal matters

fields.name: Executive branch
fields.content:
chief of state: Queen ELIZABETH II (since 6 February 1952)

head of government: Administrator Major General Robert J. THOMSON (since 25 September 2019); note - administrator reports to the British Ministry of Defense; the chief officer is responsible for the day-to-day running of the civil government of the Sovereign Bases

elections/appointments: the monarchy is hereditary; administrator appointed by the monarch on the advice of the Ministry of Defense

subfields.content: Administrator Major General Robert J. THOMSON (since 25 September 2019); note - administrator reports to the British Ministry of Defense; the chief officer is responsible for the day-to-day running of the civil government of the Sovereign Bases

fields.name: Judicial branch
fields.content:
highest courts: Senior Judges' Court (consists of several visiting judges from England and Wales)

judge selection and term of office: see entry for United Kingdom

subordinate courts: Resident Judges' Court; military courts

fields.name: Diplomatic representation in the US
fields.content: none (overseas territory of the UK)

fields.name: Diplomatic representation from the US
fields.content: none (overseas territory of the UK)

fields.name: Flag description
fields.content: the flag of the UK is used

fields.name: National anthem
fields.content: note: as a United Kingdom area of special sovereignty, "God Save the Queen" is official (see United Kingdom)

fields.name: Economic overview
fields.content: Economic activity is limited to providing services to the military and their families located in Dhekelia. All food and manufactured goods must be imported.

fields.name: Industries
fields.content: none

fields.name: Exchange rates
fields.content: note: uses the euro

fields.name: Broadcast media
fields.content: British Forces Broadcast Service (BFBS) provides multi-channel satellite TV service as well as BFBS radio broadcasts to the Dhekelia Sovereign Base

fields.name: Military - note
fields.content: defense is the responsibility of the UK; includes Dhekelia Garrison and Ayios Nikolaos Station connected by a roadway
